Sentencas: Fuel flexibility is one of the most distinguished advantages of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) over other low-temperature fuel cells.
Titulo: Slightly ruthenium doping enables better alloy nanoparticle exsolution of perovskite anode for high-performance direct-ammonia solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, the combination of ammonia fuel and SOFCs technology should be a promising clean energy system after considering the high energy density, easy transportation/storage, matured synthesis technology and carbon-free nature of NH3 as well as high efficiency of SOFCs.
Titulo: Slightly ruthenium doping enables better alloy nanoparticle exsolution of perovskite anode for high-performance direct-ammonia solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, the large-scale applications of direct-ammonia SOFCs (DA-SOFCs) are strongly limited by the inferior anti-sintering capability and catalytic activity for ammonia decomposition reaction of conventional nickel-based cermet anode.
Titulo: Slightly ruthenium doping enables better alloy nanoparticle exsolution of perovskite anode for high-performance direct-ammonia solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Herein, a slightly ruthenium (Ru) doping in perovskite oxides is proposed to promote the alloy nanoparticle exsolution, enabling better DA-SOFCs with enhanced power outputs and operational stability.
Titulo: Slightly ruthenium doping enables better alloy nanoparticle exsolution of perovskite anode for high-performance direct-ammonia solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: After treating Ru-doped Pr0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.75Ru0.05O3-delta single-phase perovskite in a reducing atmosphere, in addition to the formation of two layered Ruddlesden-Popper perovskites and Pr2O3 nanoparticles (the same as the Ru-free counterpart, Pr0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-delta), the exsolution of CoFeRu-based alloy nanoparticles is remarkably promoted.
Titulo: Slightly ruthenium doping enables better alloy nanoparticle exsolution of perovskite anode for high-performance direct-ammonia solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Such reduced Pr0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.75Ru0.05O3-delta composite anode shows superior catalytic activity and stability for NH3 decomposition reaction as well as anti-sintering capability in DA-SOFCs to those of reduced Pr0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-delta due to the facilitated nanoparticle exsolution and stronger nanoparticle/substrate interaction.
Titulo: Slightly ruthenium doping enables better alloy nanoparticle exsolution of perovskite anode for high-performance direct-ammonia solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This work provides a facile and effective strategy to design highly active and durable anodes for DA-SOFCs, promoting large-scale applications of this technology.
Titulo: Slightly ruthenium doping enables better alloy nanoparticle exsolution of perovskite anode for high-performance direct-ammonia solid oxide fuel cells

Titulo: Slightly ruthenium doping enables better alloy nanoparticle exsolution of perovskite anode for high-performance direct-ammonia solid oxide fuel cells
